description: {"blocks":[{"key":"djciu","text":"The phylum Perkinsozoa is an aquatic parasite lineage that has devastating effects on commercial and natural mollusc populations, and also comprises parasites of algae, fish and amphibians. They are related to dinoflagellates and apicomplexans and thus offer excellent genetic models for both parasitological and evolutionary studies. Genetic transformation was previously achieved for Perkinsus spp. but with few tools for transgene expression and limited selection efficacy. We have expanded the power of experimental genetic tools for Perkinsus using P. marinus as a model. We constructed a modular Golden Gate plasmid assembly system for expression of multiple genes simultaneously as the basis of this effort. This has provided a versatile platform enabling several further developments: efficient selection systems for three drugs, puromycin, bleomycin and blasticidin; eleven new promoters of variable expression strengths; and bi-cistronic transcripts using the viral 2A peptides can couple selection to the maintenance of the expression of a transgene of interest. Collectively, thesenew tools provide great new capacity to genetically modify and study Perkinsus as an aquatic parasite and evolutionary model.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":386,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":538,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":554,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":1162,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"57ioa","text":"This protocol assumes that","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3j87","text":"All modules being assembled have been “domesticated” (are free of internalBsaI andBpiI recognition sequences)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":74,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":82,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74ejg","text":"All module junctions being assembled have a unique set of compatible overhangs that specifies their order of assembly","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"donsp","text":"The acceptor plasmid has a different antibiotic resistant gene to that of all of the modules plasmids being assembled into it","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ecobh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7t78","text":"It has been found that the isoschizomer BbsI (supplied NEB) loses activity very quickly and has a lot of star-activity so it is advised not to use this.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":40,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

cases.title: Golden Gate cloning into Levels 0 and 2
